isis.stitle: FRONT STEER AXLE: EATON EFA-12 - REPLACE - KNUCKLE PIN BUSHING AND SEAL REPLACEMENT

svcproc.title: KNUCKLE PIN BUSHING AND SEAL REPLACEMENT

note.para: Early model steer axles were equipped with an upper seal only. Later models use two seals (upper and lower). Eaton Parts Kits with both seals are available. It is recommended that both seals be used when replacing seals or bushings.

step1.para: Remove grease seals from knuckle arms using suitable tool.
Drive bushings out of knuckles ( Figure 29) using suitable piloted drift (or Eaton Installation Tool, part number 700291).
Remove all foreign material from knuckle pin areas of steering knuckle and axle beam.
Wire brush machined surfaces taking care not to damage them ( Figure 30). Clean knuckle pin bores.

important.para: For proper removal and installation of knuckle pin bushings and seals, use Eaton Installation Tool part number 700291.

warning.para: During removal and installation procedures, never use steel hammer or tool to strike hardened metal parts.

note.para: When installing bushings, position seam in areas marked "X" ( Figure 33).
Some Eaton bushings require reaming after installation. Follow directions provided with bushings.

step1.para: Use same method (Next Step) to install both upper and lower bushings. To facilitate installation, lightly lubricate outside diameter of bushings.
To install bushings, first hand start bushing in bore. Then, using suitable piloted drift (or Eaton Installation Tool 700291), drive bushings in until they are properly located ( Figure 31).
Install new seal, using suitable pilot drift or similar device that will not damage seal as it is installed.

note.para: When installing grease seal, be sure lip is pointing toward center of knuckle ( Figure 32 and Figure 33). This is essential for correct seal operation.
